div.class: so-panel widget widget_shortcode-widget shortcode_widget panel-first-child panel-last-child

div.p: Niles Township High School District 219 currently serves more than 4,600 students from Lincolnwood, Skokie, and parts of Morton Grove and Niles. The purpose of District 219 is to provide an equitable, student-focused learning environment where every student graduates prepared and ready for college.

img.data-caption: Niles North geometry students took part in the 2nd annual geometry boat races.
Three Niles Central graduates received scholarships from The Education Foundation.
Niles North students took part in Stand Against Racism.
Niles West students made banners and participated in Stand Against Racism.
D219 students were selected to attend and present their projects at Intel-ISEF, the world's largest international pre-college science competition.
